answer:
<p>This question was bugging me - it's a common enough problem that a good solution should already exist, something better than the vector of vectors or rolling your own array indexing.</p>

<p>When something ought to exist in C++ but doesn't, the first place to look is <a href="http://www.boost.org/" rel="noreferrer">boost.org</a>. There I found the <a href="http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_37_0/libs/multi_array/doc/index.html" rel="noreferrer">Boost Multidimensional Array Library, <b><code>multi_array</code></b></a>. It even includes a <code>multi_array_ref</code> class that can be used to wrap your own one-dimensional array buffer.</p>
data.title: How do I declare a 2d array in C++ using new?
